Detailed Description

template<typename T>
class DRMPlugin::NZSPtr< T >

Non-zero smart pointer to template type T.

Used to reduce checking of zero pointers. Template type T must inherit GC.

Warning:
DO NOT CONSTRUCT NZSPtr<T> WITH ADDRESS OF LOCAL OBJECT OF TYPE T!

Definition at line 166 of file GC.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<typename T>
DRMPlugin::NZSPtr< T >::NZSPtr (  T *  p  )  [inline]
 

Constructor.

If pointer is not zero, increases reference count for it. If fails (pointer is zero), throws GCException.

Parameters:
p pointer to class T.

If pointer is not zero, increases reference count for it. If fails (pointer is zero), throws GCException.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T>
NZSPtr<T>& DRMPlugin::NZSPtr< T >::operator= (  const NZSPtr< T > &  rhs  )  [inline]
 

Assignment operator.

If rhs is not the same object as this one, decreases contained pointer reference count, assigns rhs's pointer to contained pointer and increases contained pointer reference count.

Parameters:
rhs input, smart pointer.
Returns:
Smart pointer reference.

bool DRMPlugin::NZSPtr< T >::operator< (  const NZSPtr< T > &  rhs  )  const [inline]
 

Less than operator.

Tests whether contained object (dereferenced contained pointer) is less than rhs's contained object (dereferenced contained pointer). Assumes that type T has less than operator.

Parameters:
rhs input, smart pointer.
Returns:
Boolean indicating whether contained object is less than rhs's contained object.
